body_html:
FYI @josh11b @jhseu

  • TF_Operation refers to an operation in the graph, which can have multiple inputs and multiple outputs.
  • TF_Output identifies the one of possibly many outputs of an operation.
  • TF_Input identifies the one of possibly many inputs of an operation.

For example, the QuantizedMatMul operation has 6 inputs and 3 outputs. TF_Input{op, 0} refers to the input a, TF_Input{op, 2} refers to the input min_a etc. while TF_Output{op, 0} refers to outputout, TF_Output{op, 1} refers to the output min_out etc.

TF_SessionRun takes as feeds the outputs of some operations and returns as fetches the outputs of others. Thus TF_Output is used to identify both.

Hope that clarifies things. That said, any suggestions to improve the naming here are appreciated. Perhaps naming the arguments to TF_SessionRun etc. as feeds and fetches instead of inputs and outputs would help a bit?
body_text:
FYI @josh11b @jhseu

TF_Operation refers to an operation in the graph, which can have multiple inputs and multiple outputs.
TF_Output identifies the one of possibly many outputs of an operation.
TF_Input identifies the one of possibly many inputs of an operation.

For example, the QuantizedMatMul operation has 6 inputs and 3 outputs.  TF_Input{op, 0} refers to the input a, TF_Input{op, 2} refers to the input min_a etc. while TF_Output{op, 0} refers to outputout, TF_Output{op, 1} refers to the output min_out etc.
TF_SessionRun takes as feeds the outputs of some operations and returns as fetches the outputs of others. Thus TF_Output is used to identify both.
Hope that clarifies things. That said, any suggestions to improve the naming here are appreciated. Perhaps naming the arguments to TF_SessionRun etc. as feeds and fetches instead of inputs and outputs would help a bit?
body:
FYI @josh11b @jhseu 

- `TF_Operation` refers to an operation in the graph, which can have multiple inputs and multiple outputs.
- `TF_Output` identifies the one of possibly many outputs of an operation.
- `TF_Input` identifies the one of possibly many inputs of an operation.

For example, the [QuantizedMatMul](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/d0aac2b/tensorflow/core/ops/math_ops.cc#L2233) operation has 6 inputs and 3 outputs.  `TF_Input{op, 0}` refers to the input `a`, `TF_Input{op, 2}` refers to the input `min_a` etc. while `TF_Output{op, 0}` refers to output`out`, `TF_Output{op, 1}` refers to the output `min_out` etc.

`TF_SessionRun` takes as feeds the outputs of some operations and returns as fetches the outputs of others. Thus `TF_Output` is used to identify both.

Hope that clarifies things. That said, any suggestions to improve the naming here are appreciated. Perhaps naming the arguments to `TF_SessionRun` etc. as `feeds` and `fetches` instead of `inputs` and `outputs` would help a bit?
